Literature Review: Intimate partner violence (IPV) is a pervasive and devastating issue that affects not only the direct victims but also their children. Exposure to IPV during childhood has been consistently linked to a range of adverse developmental outcomes, including mental health problems, social difficulties, and academic underachievement. This literature review synthesizes the existing research on the developmental consequences of IPV on children, with a particular focus on the role of child self-regulation as a mediating factor. We also highlight methodological challenges and propose a comprehensive theoretical model to guide future research and clinical practice.
